title: American_Top_40_1988_June_4th
description:
THIS FILE WAS PREVIOUSLY TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_June_4th,_1988" IF YOU DOWNLOADED THAT FILE YOU ALREADY HAVE THIS ONE. THIS IS THE NEW TORRENT OF THAT SAME FILE AND THAT TORRENT WILL NO LONGER BE SEEDED. THIS IS ONE OF THE FIRST 15 I EVER TORRENTED. I'M JUST CHANGING THE NAME SO ALL SHOW TITLES ARE FORMATTED ALIKE.
THIS FILE IS NOW BEING TORRENTED AS "American_Top_40_1988_June_4th" PLEASE DOWNLOAD THAT TORRENT. THIS FILE IS NO LONGER BE SEEDED.

"We're coming to you from Hollywood."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. Some are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.
In this broadcast:

The first and probably the only time four acts appear in a row in the countdown all from Sydney, Australia

A listener wants to know, "In the rock era, what song has spent the most weeks at number one?" With ten weeks being the record, it is a three-way tie between a Cuban bandleader, Pat Boone's daughter, and lovely "Livy" from down under. Casey plays parts of all three songs.

There is a song in the countdown that features a lead oboe. Casey tells which one.

A listener wants to know, "What the first heavy metal band to make the top ten?" Casey says this band took their name from a song that was later remade by Donny and Marie Osmond in 1976.

"Always On My Mind" by the Pet Shop Boys (at number 17) is a disco version of a country song. Casey remembers (and plays parts of) other disco remakes, including a disco version of "Stairway To Heaven."
